theorem_statement: \label{roverA} Let $n$ be a positive integer and let $A$ be a set of positive integers. For $s\in A$, we have \begin{equation} N_A^p(n)-N_A^p(n-s)=p_A(n-s)+N_{A\setminus\{s\}}^p(n) \end{equation} with $p_A(0)=1$.

sections.title: Generating Functions for $N_A^p(n)$ and $N_A^q(n)$, and Six ways to Convolution and Recurrence Identities
